channel.title: Checking bank items
channel.description: I'm trying to make a code (not gunna say what it is) but I need to make it search through your bank for a certain item and see if u have more than one of that item. anybody know what to do?

item.title: Checking bank items
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

sinisoul:

Your first example accounting for multiple stacks of similar items? Why? The amount of iterations this method would waste (especially accounting size of the array) would be a hit to the server performance. Needs a return false statement else after.

My first example is a method, the second is code to a command i threw together in a second to test.
And the bank doesn’t have multiple stacks of similar items, I don’t get where you’re pulling that information from.

Read full topic

item.title: Checking bank items
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:544218”] public boolean hasItemInBank(int item, int amount) { for (int a = 0; a < c.bankItems.length; a++) { if ((c.bankItems[a] - 1) == item && c.bankItemsN[a] >= amount) { return true; } } return false; }

Command I used for testing:

try { int item = Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]); int amount = Integer.parseInt(cmd[2]); boolean hasAmount = c.getItems().hasItemInBank(item, amount); if(hasAmount) c.sendMessage("You have at least " + amount + " " + ItemAssistant.getItemName(item) + " in your bank."); else c.sendMessage("You do not have enough " + ItemAssistant.getItemName(item) + " in your bank."); } catch(NullPointerException e) { c.sendMessage("Error processing command. try ::cb 995 50000"); }[/quote]

Your first example accounting for multiple stacks of similar items? Why? The amount of iterations this method would waste (especially accounting size of the array) would be a hit to the server performance. Needs a return false statement else after.

Read full topic

item.title: Checking bank items
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:544218”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=663099.msg4431762#msg4431762 date=1403553792]
To check do the loop to tally up $has, and then outside of the loop, make an if/else statement. You have it inside the loop.

if(command.startsWith("command")) }
	for (int j = 0; j < c.bankItems.length; j++) {
		if (c.bankItems[j] == itemID && c.bankItemsN[j] > 1) {
			$has++;
		}
	}
	if($has >= amount) {
		//player has the specified amount.
	} else {
		//player does not have the specified amount.
	}
}

[/quote]
You’re literally mixing PHP and Java.

Edit: Kieth, here’s what I was doing (proving you really need to learn how to use the method I gave you):
[/quote]

It’s a step in the right direction though, his code is essentially correct, besides a few syntax errors

Read full topic

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:13, topic:544218”]To check do the loop to tally up $has, and then outside of the loop, make an if/else statement. You have it inside the loop.

if(command.startsWith("command")) } for (int j = 0; j < c.bankItems.length; j++) { if (c.bankItems[j] == itemID && c.bankItemsN[j] > 1) { $has++; } } if($has >= amount) { //player has the specified amount. } else { //player does not have the specified amount. } } [/quote]
You’re literally mixing PHP and Java.

Edit: Kieth, here’s what I was doing (proving you really need to learn how to use the method I gave you):

item.title: Checking bank items

item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

To check do the loop to tally up $has, and then outside of the loop, make an if/else statement. You have it inside the loop.

if(command.startsWith("command")) }
	for (int j = 0; j < c.bankItems.length; j++) {
		if (c.bankItems[j] == itemID && c.bankItemsN[j] > 1) {
			$has++;
		}
	}
	if($has >= amount) {
		//player has the specified amount.
	} else {
		//player does not have the specified amount.
	}
}

Command I used for testing:

try { int item = Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]); int amount = Integer.parseInt(cmd[2]); boolean hasAmount = c.getItems().hasItemInBank(item, amount); if(hasAmount) c.sendMessage("You have at least " + amount + " " + ItemAssistant.getItemName(item) + " in your bank."); else c.sendMessage("You do not have enough " + ItemAssistant.getItemName(item) + " in your bank."); } catch(NullPointerException e) { c.sendMessage("Error processing command. try ::cb 995 50000"); }[/quote]

not gunna work, i need it to check if u have OVER 1 of the item left, that code doesnt specify which item it is in the bank that its checking, and its checking for 500

item.title: Checking bank items
item.dc:creator: @Revamp_dis_Shit Revamp dis Shit
item.description:
@Revamp_dis_Shit wrote:

[quote=“ReaperXScape, post:8, topic:544218”]so i added this, and all it does is spam the chatbox the amount of times of items I have in my bank, so if I have 500 of an item, it spams the message 500 times… code :

for (int a = 0; a < c.bankItems.length; a++) { if (c.bankItems[a] == c.int4thiscode + 1 && c.bankItemsN[a] > 1) { c.addItem(c.int4thiscode, 1); } else { c.sendMessage("You do not have enough of itemId "+c.int4thiscode+" in the bank."); } } [/quote]
I tried to think of something to contribute to this thread so I won’t be penalized by the police staff members here… but I failed to do so.
So here it is…

Lmao Kieth this is what you’re doing in your free time? Might as well go back to RS3…maybe next time I’ll make this a PM so I won’t get abused by the staff…but we’ll just wait and see how this plays out I suppose…inb4modsoverreact

Read full topic

item.title: Checking bank items
item.dc:creator: @ReaperXScape ReaperXScape
item.description:
@ReaperXScape wrote:

so i added this, and all it does is spam the chatbox the amount of times of items I have in my bank, so if I have 500 of an item, it spams the message 500 times… code :

for (int a = 0; a < c.bankItems.length; a++) {
	if (c.bankItems[a] == c.int4thiscode + 1 && c.bankItemsN[a] > 1) {
c.addItem(c.int4thiscode, 1);
	} else {
	c.sendMessage("You do not have enough of itemId "+c.int4thiscode+" in the bank.");
	}
}

item.title: Checking bank items
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

I’m not a Java pro, so I’m not completely positive, but I don’t see why this wouldn’t work:

for (int j = 0; j < c.bankItems.length; j++) { if (c.bankItems[j] == itemID) { //has the item $has++; } }

Just after the loop, if the player has the item, do $has++. Keep in mind that you have to declare the new int “has”.
